summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, scheduled to commence on November 29, 2021, at the Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse in New York. The order outlines COVID-19 protocols and procedures for public, press, and victim access to the trial, including the use of overflow courtrooms with live video and audio feeds.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose trial is the subject of this court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order detailing trial access and COVID-19 protocols.

events.title: Trial of Ghislaine Maxwell Commences
events.description: The criminal trial of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin.

locations: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York
40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to commence on November 29, 2021.
The court order establishes specific COVID-19 protocols for courthouse access, including health questionnaires, temperature checks, and mask requirements.
Public and press access to the trial was facilitated through the main courtroom, dedicated press overflow rooms, and public overflow rooms with live video/audio feeds.
The order references provisions for access by alleged victims and members of the defendant's family.
The order is signed by United States District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
